page.title: 05HARTSHEAD PIKE
page.content:
This landmark dominates the landscape from all angles. It is situated about 282 metres above sea level surveying the old counties of Lancashire, Yorkshire, Cheshire and Derbyshire. On a clear day, there is a breath-taking view over the Cheshire Plain to the Welsh Mountains in the distance. Originally a {ROMAN FIRE BEACON it became a lookout post garrisoned by the Home Guard during the Second World War. Recently it has been sand blasted but the windows and door have been bricked up to prevent vandalism.
A pilot using a visual method of approach to Manchester International Airport would use {HARTSHEAD PIKE } as a prominent landmark.
